post_title: What information did you learn late into playing cs that helped you?
post_body: Im curious what mechanical or mental information you learned pretty late into playing cs that made you a lot better after learning it? Something you learned maybe 2k hours into playing? It can be something mechanical like how to aim correctly or WHEN to peek/when to use certain peeks. Maybe you watched a pro vod and noticed some mechanical thing a player did that you never thought about or something about positioning or utility? Just trying to spark some ideas into my head for things to change. im in a rough patch playing cs where I haven't top-fragged in a faceit 10 lobby in a very long time and I feel like im on an extreme plateau. i just want to see if there is useful information that could help me out. (it could also be something you actually did wrong for a very long time but you never noticed it and decided to change it.)

post_title: What's your "secret" pro tips in CS?
post_body: My golden rule is to avoid throwing nades in situations where the enemy doesn't know where I am (for example in a 1v2 post-plant - or when I'm sneaking out B apps on Mirage) to surprise the enemy. Anything you have?

post_title: Switching between a light spectate and someone in a smoke can let you see enemies in the smoke
post_body:
I experienced this while playing and was very glad it shows through on the gotv recording.

When dead, if you click and switch back and forth between someone standing in a smoke and someone with a light background, the silhouette of someone hiding in the smoke sometimes shows.

https://imgur.com/o04gNR5

post_title: CS2 feels weird, and I dont know why...
post_body:
Something is... off.

My aim is weird, it feels like my crosshair is lagging across the screen rather than one fluid motion. The game feels like its running 60hz even though its 144hz. The FPS lows are huge and the entire game feels like a clunky mess which wasnt the case just a week ago.

All Ive done recently was turn on memory integrity to get the Faceit AC working but surely that cant cause all these issues? Maybe my mouse is broken? Maybe some PC component is starting to break? Anyone else had similar issues?

post_title: Does CSGO have one of the best communities?
post_body:
Okay, I just stumbled upon this precious [post](https://www.reddit.com/r/GlobalOffensive/comments/1z6ujl/does_csgo_have_one_of_the_best_communities/from) 11 years ago about how wholesome the CSGO community was, and I literally can't- ðŸ’€

The OP was like "everyone's so nice and encouraging!" and I'm sitting here in CS2 being called a "kitchen camper" just for clutching a 1v3. Like, honey, the only thing that hasn't changed in 11 years is my aim being better than your attitude!

Don't get me wrong, I've met some amazing people in CS2 (shoutout to my homies who doesn't immediately mute me when they hear my voice), but watching this community evolve has been wilder than my spray patterns!

What do happened? Did we lose our wholesome gamers to Valorant, or did everyone just become extra spicy after getting one too many Zeus kills...

xoxo

post_title: Distorted/Broken audio in Cs2, Using Scarlet 4i4 and a ROG STRIX G513
post_body:
Pretty much went to install CS2, first night went well but the next day I booted it up to play with my friends and I can only describe it as getting ear raped by every noise in the client. Every single noise had static/distortion was sometimes laggy and was super boosted in volume. **To be clear I only have this issue with CS2.** I've seen a couple other threads on this issue that seemed similar, notably this [one](https://www.reddit.com/r/GlobalOffensive/comments/168e2ty/distortedbroken_sound_in_cs2/), but my problem still remains. My audio setup is a Scarlet 4i4 plugged into a ROG Strix G513, with my audio input and output routed through the 4i4 by usb.

  
Things I've Tried.

* Updating Realtek Audio Drivers through windows
* updating Focusrite Control 2
* Restarting (I shutdown nightly)
* Deleting CFG folder in the steam directory and Restarting game

  
The only things I have yet to try are updating to windows 11 (its installing) and routing my headphones through my laptop which I would prefer to avoid if I can. Anyone have any other ideas?

post_title: Inspect bug?
post_body:
Anybody else having issues with inspect?

Mine is bound to X....when I hit inspect at the start of the game it will do it...but it glitches and its as if I am holding down X. If I switch weapons its still spamming inspect.

Once I left click, the inspecting stops then I can't inspect for the rest of the game...

Anybody else?

  
EDIT

I fixed it.

For some reason my autoexec isnt working at all, even though it is in counterstike global offensve > game > csgo > cfg.

I checked the console on launch and the echo wasnt showing...I copy and pasted these commands into the console:

>

>

>

And it worked perfectly and my inspect is now fixed... Thanks for your help man you helped me get to the root of the issue. Not sure why my autoexec isnt working but whatever dont care.

post_title: Please help
post_body: I was playing Counter-Strike and I loaded up a casual map. No one was there apart from bots, so everything was normal until after round 2. A lot of people joined, and at first, I thought it was normal, but then I checked their names out of habit, and all of them were Chinese. Literally, every single person on the Terrorist and Counter-Terrorist teams had the exact same name. I was confused. So the round just finished, and when I spawned back to T spawn, all of them were AFKâ€” all 9 players. I waited for a few seconds, and they all shot at the same time. I was freaked out, so I went to check on the Counter-Terrorists, and they were doing the exact same thingâ€” AFK and shooting randomly every few seconds. Then a real person joined and immediately voted to kick me, and it literally took 2 seconds for all the Terrorists to vote F1. Can someone please explain? Because I'm genuinely fucking  horrified
